project.teaser: The automotive industry faces tremendous challenges in addressing decarbonization through electrification, developing future solutions for inclusive, safe and affordable mobility. Many of these changes require a radical re-thinking of existing development processes, with the...
project.objective: The automotive industry faces tremendous challenges in addressing decarbonization through electrification, developing future solutions for inclusive, safe and affordable mobility. Many of these changes require a radical re-thinking of existing development processes, with the share of software in modern mobility solutions continuously increasing. The rising importance of the software layer results in the so-called software-defined vehicle (SDV). Automotive software will be developed and adapted in continuous cycles. Therefore an abstraction from the underlying hardware needs to be implemented. As a result, the automotive industry is transitioning to an agile software development process. The dramatic increase of software and complexity, along with the advances of international competition in this domain, calls for an approach, in which non-differentiating software is developed jointly as open source. To address these challenges, the EU, together with industry, governments, and research institutions, have launched the European SDV Ecosystem. To turn this into reality, this proposal outlines the vision and activities for a Coordination and Support Action. FEDERATE (Software-Defined Vehicle Support and Coordination Project) aims to bring together all relevant stakeholders to accelerate the development of an SDV Ecosystem, to foster a vibrant European community and orchestrate the SDV R&D&I activities. The consortium of FEDERATE is formed by major European OEMs, automotive tiers, semiconductor companies, relevant industry associations and industrial SDV initiatives, including the Eclipse SDV WG, and supported by a scientific board. FEDERATE will work towards a common understanding on the vision of the SDV program and create an orchestrated advice for current and future projects in the SDV program. In addition, recommendations for future calls are prepared in alignment with a Roadmap and Joint Vision Document for accelerated SDV R&D&I, created as part of the CSA
project.title: SoFtwarE DefinEd vehicle suppoRt And coordinaTion projEct
project.keywords: Software defined vehicle, SDV, Open Source, SDV Ecosystem, SDV HW Platform, Coordination, Support

article.title: Paving the way for Europe’s software-defined vehicle of the future

details.authors: Bugar, Andreas Cuenot, Philippe Leimbach, Jürgen Niklas-Hoeret, Michael

result.title: First Report of high level requirement list
result.description: First release of the high-level requirements repository, then continuously updated throughout the project. It will be available to the consortium online.

result.title: Dissemination plan
result.description: Dissemination Plan to describe the planned activities with respect to publications and events during the project.

result.title: Quality and Risk management plan
result.description: Quality measures and risks and mitigation actions planned.

result.title: Vision Document
result.description: Document describing the vision of the SDV ecosystem program.

details.authors: Ella Peltonen, Vishaka Basnayake, Olli Timonen, Heidi Hietala, Yueqiang Xu, Sarthak Acharya, Alireza Bakhshi Zadi Mahmoodi, Tero Päivärinta University of Oulu, Finland Bastian Lampe Institute for Automotive Engineering (ika), RWTH Aachen University, Germ

result.title: Strategic Roadmap - First Version
result.description: First version of the Roadmap recommending how the vision of the SDV Ecosystem program can be achieved in a combination with publicly funded cooperative projects in close cooperation with industrial initiatives for an SDV Ecosystem. The roadmap should preferably also contain indications to the extent that this information can be disclosed by the OEMs, when results will be integrated into the OEMs’s products.

result.title: First Dissemination and Communication Activities report
result.description: First Dissemination report, incl. impact and outcomes of SDV Ecosystem Forum, report on SDV conferences, surveys and workshops.

result.title: Glossary (incl. layer structure)
result.description: Definition of common terms as well as a layer structure for the categorization of the modular building blocks.

result.title: First Report of high level requirement list
Stakeholder engagement strategy
result.description: Stakeholder engagement strategy incl. concept for Open SDV Ecosystem Forum.

result.title: First Year data management report
result.description: First year Report on Data Management activities and results, which include quality assurance and consistency checks of reports.

result.title: Initial Recommendations for Building Block Realization
First Technology Forecast Report
result.description: Technology Forecast Report including the first release of an SDV glossary, then continuously updated throughout the project. It will be available to the consortium online.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - FEDERATE (SoFtwarE DefinEd vehicle suppoRt And coordinaTion projEct)
result.teaser: To address challenges in decarbonization through electrification and in developing future solutions for inclusive, safe and affordable mobility, the EC, together with industry, governments, and research institutions, has launched the European Software-Defined Vehicle of the...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Data management plan
result.description: Data Management Plan to address all data-related aspects in the project and the handling of these according to the FAIR (findable, accessible, interoperable and reusable) principles.

result.title: Kuura: Leveraging Eclipse Kuksa in Vehicular Data Collection and Digital Twin Creation Environment
Initial Recommendations for building block realization
result.description: Initial recommendations updated once a year aligned with the planning processes of the related funding programs, which modular building blocks shall be developed / updated in which planned new calls in relevant EC funding programs. If required advice can be given on which industry SDV initiative shall be involved. This Delivery will be updated annually based on the schedule of the different programs.

result.title: First Prioritized backlog report
result.description: First Prioritized backlog of modular SDV Ecosystem building blocks.

result.title: First Orchestrated backlog report
result.description: First version of a Backlog of modular building blocks assigned to R&D projects of the SDV program. Optionally, this report proposes adoption by a specific SDV-SW initiative (e.g. Autosar, Eclipse, ...).

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

category.title: HORIZON JU Coordination and Support Actions
category.description: HORIZON JU Coordination and Support Actions
